titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edison Price Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Suzanne Noruschat and Jessica Quagliaroli

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 07:46

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection is comprised of business and design records generated by the two lighting design, manufacturing, and consulting companies founded by Edison Price in New York, New York: Edison Price, Inc. (founded in 1952) and Nulux, Inc. (founded in 1990). Papers include both project and product records, as well as research files, patent documents, and general documentation about the firms. Project records consist of drawings, correspondence, and notes relating to lighting designs, including such projects as the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library at Yale University, the Whitney Museum of Art, the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, and the J. Paul Getty Center in Los Angeles. Product records consist of drawings, photometric reports, and other information for a range of fixtures designed and manufactured by Edison Price, Inc. and Nulux, Inc.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Named after the famed inventor, Thomas Alva Edison, Edison Avery Price (1918-1997) entered the field of lighting design through employment at Display Stage Lighting, Inc., a company founded by his father, William E. Price, in New York City in 1917. The younger Price worked at Display Stage Lighting, which specialized in theatrical lighting, from 1935 to 1946, and from 1946 to 1949 undertook the roles of Treasurer and Vice President in charge of design, development, and production at successor firm Display Lighting, Inc. Upon leaving the family business in 1949, Price operated as a self-employed lighting consultant. In 1952 he founded Edison Price, Inc., which grew from a small architectural lighting company based in a Manhattan loft to a design, manufacturing, and consulting firm whose roster of clients included Louis Kahn, Marcel Breuer, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe, Philip Johnson, I.M. Pei, Edward Larrabee Barnes, and Skidmore, Owings, & Merrill. Price provided services and fixtures for such renowned projects as Pei's Grand Louvre in Paris, Buckminster Fuller's geodesic dome at the Montreal 1967 Expo, Breuer's Whitney Museum, Mies and Johnson's Four Seasons Restaurant in the Seagram Building, and Kahn's Yale University Art Gallery, the last of which Price undertook in collaboration with his long-time associate, lighting consultant Richard Kelly. After leaving Edison Price, Inc., Price founded Nulux, Inc., in 1990.

Throughout his career, Price designed and manufactured his own products. He developed and customized lighting solutions and fixtures for specific architectural spaces, and employed individuals with similar design aesthetics to complete his company's designs, such as lighting engineer Isaac Goodbar. Simplicity was the hallmark of his fixtures, which tended to blend unobtrusively with the architectural setting. Continuous lighting tracks and recessed fixtures, for instance, were early innovations of the firm that became commonplaces of the industry. Price was expert at illuminating a variety of interiors, from offices and theaters, to museums and libraries.

In recognition of his contributions to the advancement of architectural lighting, Price was awarded the Richard Kelly Lifetime Achievement Award by the Illuminating Engineering Society and, in 1981, the AIA Medal by the American Institute of Architects.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Edison Price Records (MS 2015). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user. Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials contained in this collection cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of business and design records generated by the two lighting design, manufacturing, and consulting companies founded by Edison Price in New York, New York: Edison Price, Inc. (founded in 1952) and Nulux, Inc. (founded in 1990). Papers include both project and product records, as well as research files, patent documents, and general documentation about the firms. Project records consist of drawings, correspondence, and notes relating to lighting designs, including such projects as the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library at Yale University, the Whitney Museum of Art, the Guggenheim Museum Bilbao, and the J. Paul Getty Center in Los Angeles. Product records consist of drawings, photometric reports, and other information for a range of fixtures designed and manufactured by Edison Price, Inc. and Nulux, Inc.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in seven series: I. General Company Information, 1952-1999. II. Research Files and Notes, 1940-1999. III. Patents, 1950-1997. IV. Project Files, 1956-1998. V. Fixtures and Products, 1965-1999. VI. Slides, Negatives, and Photographs, 1953-1996. VII. Personal Papers, 1910-1986.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Duplicate materials were removed from the collection.

controlaccess.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, financial records, and lists of projects generated by the two lighting design, manufacturing, and consulting companies founded by Edison Price in New York, New York: Edison Price, Inc. (founded in 1952) and Nulux, Inc. (founded in 1990). Also included are awards from the American Institute of Architects and Illuminating Engineering Society.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by company. Folders within each company are arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Articles and writing, Illuminating Engineering Society Lighting Handbook
Illuminating Engineering Society Richard Kelly Award, press releases and mailing lists
Project list, Innovative and Memorable Projects
Names for fixtures, number system, and graphics
Illuminating Engineering Society, "Pioneer of Light: Edison Avery Price"
Tribute to Edison Price by Brooks Bragdon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is primarily comprised of research files on lighting companies, designers, and equipment. Also included are daily and weekly lists of projects with status updates for Edison Price, Inc.'s early projects.

did.unittitle: Code change, City of New York
Hepworth Machine Co. Inc., tools for metal spinning
Jig to machine, pin cam nut
Weekly lists of projects and status updates for Edison Price, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence to lawyers and lighting design companies, including Sylvan R. Shemitz and Associates, Inc., as well as research documentation pertaining to Edison Price's patent applications.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by two groupings: general patent documentation and fixtures and products. Folders within each grouping are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of drawings, sketches, correspondence, and notes documenting Edison Price, Inc. and Nulux, Inc. projects.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by project name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of drawings, photometric reports, and product brochures for fixtures designed and manufactured by Edison Price, Inc. and Nulux, Inc.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged by company. Folders within the Edison Price, Inc. grouping are arranged by general documentation and fixtures and products. Folders are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: This series contains slides, negatives, and photographs documenting the fixtures, products, and projects completed by Edison Price, Inc. and Nulux, Inc.

arrangement.p: This series is arranged by format type. Folders within the format type groupings are arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs and personal records attributed to Edison Price and his parents, William Price and Alice Price.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by family member name. Folders within each family member grouping are arranged alphabetically.
